['', 'Our Values:', 'Experience with a variety of database management systems beyond relational databases', 'INNOVATION - Leading with discovery and creative solutions', 'Summary', '*remote candidates must be willing to travel periodically (at least once a month) to Farmington, CT or Bar Harbor, ME campuses.', 'JAX-GM sits on a 17-acre site on the campus of the University of Connecticut Health Center. The 183,500-square-foot facility opened in the fall of 2014. Now, it houses over 300 biomedical researchers, technicians, and support staff in state-of-the-art computing facilities and laboratories.', 'The Jackson Laboratory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, national origin, veteran status, and other classifications protected by applicable state and local non-discrimination laws.', "This role will have a high impact on big data projects supporting research at the forefront of genetics and genomics.\xa0This is an exciting opportunity to work creatively solving tough problems with truly big data. The solutions you develop will lead to better understanding of highly complex biological systems, and support the search for cures to cancer, diabetes, Alzheimer's disease and other genetic disorders.", 'PEOPLE - Inspiring our people to enhance the health of all', 'ONE TEAM - Unified by our promise to transform medicine and science', 'What do we have to offer?', 'Leading the development of scientific software applications and systems to support research at The Jackson Laboratory.\xa0\xa0', 'Minimum of five (5) years of experience in software development', 'Experience with operational tools such as Git, JetBrains IDE products (PyCharm, Idea), CI Tools such as Jenkins or Bamboo, Atlassian Suite', 'Experience in identifying and developing software applications in the biomedical sciences and/or bioinformatics and implementing systems for analyzing large-scale scientific data is a plus', 'Experience with and capable of working in an agile development environment', 'Learn more about career opportunities at JAX:\xa0http://www.jax.org/careers.', 'As a Big Data Sofware Engineer come join a dynamic team and have a high impact on big data projects at the leading edge of biomedical research.', 'Minimum of five (5) years of experience in software developmentA BS degree or higher in computer science, information science or equivalent on-the-job experienceExperience with a variety of database management systems beyond relational databasesExperience with operational tools such as Git, JetBrains IDE products (PyCharm, Idea), CI Tools such as Jenkins or Bamboo, Atlassian SuiteExperience with and capable of working in an agile development environmentExperience or knowledge with machine learning applications at scaleExperience in identifying and developing software applications in the biomedical sciences and/or bioinformatics and implementing systems for analyzing large-scale scientific data is a plusStrong knowledge of Linux environments\xa0Knowledge in statistics, biology, genomics are considered a plus', 'A BS degree or higher in computer science, information science or equivalent on-the-job experience', 'JAX employees work in a collaborative, value-driven, and team-based environment where the focus is on advancing science and improving patients’ lives. Researchers apply genetics to increase the understanding of human disease and advance treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging, and heart disease. JAX was voted among the top 15 “Best Places to Work in Academia” in the United States in a poll conducted by The Scientist magazine!', 'STEWARDSHIP - Caring for and enhancing the resources entrusted to us', 'Lead the development of large complex projects with team members including software engineers, bioinformatics analysts, statisticians and scientists.', 'The Jackson Laboratory (JAX,\xa0www.jax.org) is a nonprofit biomedical research institute with over 2,000 employees whose mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for human disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health. A National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center, JAX has a mammalian genetics headquarters in Bar Harbor, Maine, a facility in Sacramento, California, and a genomic medicine facility, The Jackson Laboratory for Genomic Medicine (JAX-GM), in Farmington, Connecticut.', "Identify and lead big data opportunities within the organization and enhance the team's expertise with managing large scale data both on-premise and in the cloud", 'Experience or knowledge with machine learning applications at scale', 'About Us', 'Function as part of a highly productive software team and will work closely with researchers across all three campuses to develop tools to aid in their research.\xa0\xa0', 'Qualifications', '\xa0', 'JAX offers a dynamic and supportive work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, including a medical plan, outstanding retirement plan, generous paid time off, and tuition reimbursement including an MBA program. Our campus offers a fitness center with an award-winning wellness program and an onsite full service cafeteria.', 'The Jackson Laboratory for Genomic Medicine in Farmington, CT is seeking a Senior Software Engineer for Data Engineering. This position reports to the Associate Director of Computational Sciences Scientific Computing (CSSC) team that is primarily responsible for developing software applications for scientific research programs.\xa0', "JAX-GM is transforming medicine by improving patient care, lowering costs, and increasing life span and health span. JAX-GM’s research focuses on the complex genetic causes of disease and on the development of genomic solutions tailored to each person's unique genetic makeup.", 'EXCELLENCE - Achieving world-class results', 'Most importantly, every position contributes to JAX’s mission of discovering precise genomic solutions for human disease and empowering the global biomedical community in our shared quest to improve human health.', 'Learn more about career opportunities at JAX:\xa0', 'INTEGRITY - Courage and commitment to do what is right', "Leading the development of scientific software applications and systems to support research at The Jackson Laboratory.\xa0\xa0Lead the development of large complex projects with team members including software engineers, bioinformatics analysts, statisticians and scientists.Identify and lead big data opportunities within the organization and enhance the team's expertise with managing large scale data both on-premise and in the cloudDemonstrate knowledge of a cross section of tools and techniques relating to support of large-scale data analysisFunction as part of a highly productive software team and will work closely with researchers across all three campuses to develop tools to aid in their research.\xa0\xa0", 'JAX-GM resides in the scenic town of Farmington, in the state’s capitol region. The Hartford region, which offers some of the best public schools in the country, is made up of both bigger cities and smaller, charming historic New England towns.\xa0JAX-GM is also geographically located within 2 hours of Boston and New York and is close to multiple transportation systems, including bus lines, highways, railroads and international airports.', 'Demonstrate knowledge of a cross section of tools and techniques relating to support of large-scale data analysis', 'Responsibilities', 'Knowledge in statistics, biology, genomics are considered a plus', 'Strong knowledge of Linux environments\xa0']

['', 'Required Qualifications ', 'At least three (3) years in a geography/ GIS environment developing analytical solutions using advanced spatial statistical methods, application development and deployment, data visualization, and spatial modeling ', 'Experience (2 years) scripting with Python or similar programming language, or experience (2 years) performing statistical analysis using R and/or ESRI GeoStatistical Analyst ', 'At least five (5) years’ experience using ESRI product suite (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcCatalog, and ArcGIS Online) including writing SQL expressions for GIS queries ', 'Any combination of the following: GISP, ESRI Certification, Alteryx Certification, Data Science Certificate', 'Experience (4 years) scripting with Python or similar programming language, or experience (4 years) performing statistical analysis using R ', '• providing insightful consultation and recommendations to help drive decision making processes in retail and support by developing analyses, metrics and reports. ', 'Bachelor’s degree in Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering or another analytical discipline from an accredited college or university At least three (3) years in a geography/ GIS environment developing analytical solutions using advanced spatial statistical methods, application development and deployment, data visualization, and spatial modeling At least three (3) years’ experience using ESRI product suite (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcCatalog, and ArcGIS Online) including writing SQL expressions for GIS queries Experience (2 years) scripting with Python or similar programming language, or experience (2 years) performing statistical analysis using R and/or ESRI GeoStatistical Analyst Experience (2 years) using Alteryx and/or ESRI Model Builder to automate processes, reports, and application development ', 'Are you interested in applying your GIS and Location Analytics skillset to a fortune 100 retailer? Do you have an innate curiosity to seek out insights and provide recommendations utilizing cutting edge technology and data? Are you looking for a career where site selection, growth, human geography problems come across your desk every day?The Location Analytics Developer consults with business partners to provide research based recommendations in support of strategic decisions for Publix.  This includes managing the development and deployment of analytical solutions by researching and gathering data, performing statistical analyses to glean insights, software coding and training end users on the use and interpretation of these solutions.  The Location Analytics Developer drives results, provides consultation, and end-user application development regarding location-specific recommendations, opportunities, or business initiatives.  These could be in store (market or customer level), in support of multiple business areas, for real estate purchase purposes, alternative business concepts, IS/TS, or merchandising initiatives.  This position is responsible for providing in-depth consultation for these location-specific initiatives, which may be ongoing initiatives.  Location analytics solutions are also developed into user-friendly applications and placed into a self-service Alteryx server or ArcGIS Online platform for business partners to access independently.  By maintaining the Alteryx server, and ArcGIS Online platform, the GIS team is able to continually take on new data requests while current customers are self-maintained.  This allows Developers to have more time to focus on the consultation and application development portion of their position.  Furthermore, this position is responsible for overseeing GIS-related suppliers and providing guidance to GIS Analysts, and continually seeking to gain additional knowledge in data analytics, statistical methods, and predictive/prescriptive modeling.The Location Analytics Developer reports to the GIS Analytics Manager.Responsible for: ', 'Experience (2 years) using Alteryx and/or ESRI Model Builder to automate processes, reports, and application development ', '• developing GIS analytical solutions or applications, actionable tools, and recommendations to assist in making key decisions regarding locations (store, market, customer level), alternative business concept, merchandising initiative, etc. ', '• managing special Marketing related assignments, which can include but is not limited to: ', 'MBA or Masters in Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or another analytical discipline from an accredited college or university. At least five (5) years in a geography/ GIS environment developing analytical solutions using advanced spatial statistical methods, application development and deployment, data visualization, and spatial modeling At least five (5) years’ experience using ESRI product suite (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcCatalog, and ArcGIS Online) including writing SQL expressions for GIS queries Experience (4 years) scripting with Python or similar programming language, or experience (4 years) performing statistical analysis using R Experience (5 years) using Alteryx or a similar ETL tool to automate processes, reports, and application development Experience with distributed big data tools and processes Any combination of the following: GISP, ESRI Certification, Alteryx Certification, Data Science Certificate', '• coordinating with the Data Scientist, Sr Location Analytics Developers (currently titled MA Senior Consultant) and Mgr GIS & Location Analytics to proactively seek learning and training opportunities regarding predictive regression modeling software for creating regression models (linear, multivariate, logistic, Bayesian, stepwise, prescriptive, etc.), and data visualizations (ESRI, Alteryx, and Tableau). ', 'Bachelor’s degree in Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering or another analytical discipline from an accredited college or university ', 'At least five (5) years in a geography/ GIS environment developing analytical solutions using advanced spatial statistical methods, application development and deployment, data visualization, and spatial modeling ', 'Location Analytics Developer, Marketing, - Lakeland ', '• assigning specific work tasks and training and coaching GIS Data Analysts in best practices in terms of analytical technologies, methodologies, verification, knowledge of data sets, drawing insights, and communicating learnings. ', 'MBA or Masters in Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or another analytical discipline from an accredited college or university. ', '• maintaining established data and analytical software and services supplier relationships as assigned to ensure GIS Location Analytics receives ongoing support for those products or services Publix is contracted to receive. ', '• dedicating time to marketing innovation and quality improvement. ', 'Description ', 'Experience (5 years) using Alteryx or a similar ETL tool to automate processes, reports, and application development ', 'Location Analytics Developer, Marketing, - Lakeland', 'At least three (3) years’ experience using ESRI product suite (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcCatalog, and ArcGIS Online) including writing SQL expressions for GIS queries ', '• architecting database schemas (blueprint for how data is structured) by developing the logical and physical data models necessary to support the analytical solutions. ', ' ', 'Preferred Qualifications ', 'Experience with distributed big data tools and processes ']

job_text: ['', 'Qualifications:', 'Master’s Degree preferred ', 'Working knowledge of MS tools, including MS Office products, MS Access, MS Project, SQL and SAS or other statistical software.  Should be proficient in Microsoft Excel. ', 'Facilitates workgroup sessions, applies business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and improve processes. ', 'Serves as data expert for department. Advises Finance department on data warehouse design requests and works with IT to establish priorities. ', 'Applies specialized technical and analytic skill to produce analyses, reports, and applications to enhance the development and analysis of healthcare cost data and trends, while performing analytical and technical tasks necessary to execute each phase of an analysis based on an advanced understanding of managed care concepts, basic methodological design, and excellent writing. \xa0 ', 'Assists in providing technical support, training and guidance to application end users on implementation and underlying business issues and healthcare cost drivers. ', 'Qualifications:\xa0 ', '\xa0 ', 'Key Functions/Responsibilities:\xa0 ', 'Key Functions/Responsibilities:', 'Responsible for project deliverables by developing project and communication plans, risk analysis, schedules along with other project management deliverables while consistently reporting status to management. ', 'Experience:', 'Responsible for adhoc analytics including modeling of benefit scenarios and data to support provider recontracting. Utilizes statistical applications as necessary. ', 'Strong communications skills, both verbal and written, are required. ', 'Uses SAS and/or SQL coding to pull claims and membership data to support involved healthcare analytics. Supports the development of effective medical management programs/initiatives through analyzing, monitoring, and reporting the effectiveness of these programs. Develops and implements plans to measure and report on corporate-wide health care delivery cost and utilization trends. Responsible for adhoc analytics including modeling of benefit scenarios and data to support provider recontracting. Utilizes statistical applications as necessary. Serves as data expert for department. Advises Finance department on data warehouse design requests and works with IT to establish priorities. Creates and presents analyses of complex data projects explaining trends and areas of opportunity to senior management. Assists in providing technical support, training and guidance to application end users on implementation and underlying business issues and healthcare cost drivers. Leads analytical projects by coordinating all stages of the development life cycle. Facilitates workgroup sessions, applies business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and improve processes. Responsible for project deliverables by developing project and communication plans, risk analysis, schedules along with other project management deliverables while consistently reporting status to management. ', ' *Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Health Care Administration, or related field required. Master’s Degree preferred ', 'Ability to meet deadlines, multi-task, problem solve and use appropriate technology to analyze business problems. Project management skills a plus. ', 'Experience:\xa0 ', 'Creates and presents analyses of complex data projects explaining trends and areas of opportunity to senior management. ', 'Leads analytical projects by coordinating all stages of the development life cycle. ', '\xa0', 'Uses SAS and/or SQL coding to pull claims and membership data to support involved healthcare analytics. ['', '• Enable the synthetic biology platform at LifeMine by creating the necessary tools for heterologous expression of fungal biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs).', '• Excellent written and oral communication skills are required.', 'Job Summary', '• Actively collaborate with LifeMine’s Genomics, Microbiology, Natural Product Chemistry, and Mass Spectroscopy groups to interpret data and design new experiments.\xa0', 'Job Requirements', 'LifeMine Therapeutics, Inc. is the first biotechnology company exploiting the unique ability of fungi to produce powerful drugs optimized through billions of years of evolution, with the overall mission to discover and deploy new molecules for the treatment of intractable human diseases via novel biological mechanisms.\xa0The company is using genome mining and synthetic biology approaches to mount a massive campaign for finding novel drugs throughout the fungal biosphere.\xa0With operations in Cambridge and Gloucester Harbor, MA, and New York, NY, LifeMine brings a unique approach to its revolutionary scientific and medical mission.\xa0', '• Experience in fungal secondary metabolite regulation, biosynthesis, and metabolism a plus.\xa0', '• Spearhead the prosecution of molecular biology-based assays to complement the fermentation of fungal strains.', '• Ph.D. in molecular biology, biochemistry, microbiology, chemistry, or related field, with specialization in metabolic engineering of organisms for production of chemicals.', '• Experience with scaling molecular biology work flows with automation a plus.', '• Sense of adventure and excitement to build a new company and work in a highly dynamic multidisciplinary team environment.', '• Advanced knowledge in PCR, cDNA synthesis, and seamless cloning.', '• Experience in heterologous expression using orthogonal synthetic expression systems.', 'Company Description', 'We are seeking a PhD Scientist/Senior Scientist with deep expertise in the use of synthetic biology tools to clone, engineer, and manipulate fungal secondary metabolite clusters to increase the titers of natural product production and establish LifeMine’s fungal genomically-enabled drug discovery platform.\xa0This position is located in Cambridge, MA.', '• Develop synthetic biology strategies to increase production titers of natural products.\xa0', 'Job Responsibilities', '• Develop a high throughput platform leveraging automation to precisely excise, clone BGCs and transform model filamentous fungal chassis to evaluate expression', '• Advanced knowledge in the use of bioinformatics tools (such as Snapgene and Geneious) to analyze DNA sequences and design cloning strategies.', '• Create natural product analogues through biosynthetic cluster engineering.', '• Advanced knowledge in DNA isolation and assembly, emerging CRISPR technologies, and homologous recombination genome engineering protocols.\xa0', '• Experience using synthetic biology to modify secondary metabolism gene clusters.', '• Desire to develop into a significant presence and leader in a laboratory setting, being involved in the design, and downstream prosecution of efforts resulting from your data.', '• Proactively evaluate new technologies, be versed with current literature, and implement new features and functionality into the genomically-enabled drug discovery pipeline.', '\xa0', '• 0-4 years industry experience for Scientist level, 4+ years industry experience preferred for Senior Scientist level.']

['', 'A Little Bit About Us', ' Architect, build real-time batch data pipelines and data aggregation systems to deliver quality real-time analytical reports for our internal and external customers. Collaborate with Data Scientists, Backend Engineers, Data & Infrastructure Operations, and Products Managers to deliver new Data Platform capabilities. Develop clean, safe, testable, and cost-efficient solutions. Make well-informed decisions with deep knowledge of both the internal and external impacts on teams and projects. Foresee shortcomings ahead of time and be able to drive to resolution. ', 'As a Senior Software Engineer - Big Data Platform, you’ll get to:', ' BS in Computer Science or equivalent 8+ years experience, 3+ in Big Data Engineering Strong development skills in Java or Scala Solid background in the fundamentals of computer science, distributed systems, large scale data processing as well as a mastery of database designs and data warehousing. Practical experience managing AWS Cloud environments Experience in containerized deployment or Kubernetes is a big plus! Good understanding of a broad spectrum of NoSQL, traditional RDBMS, and analytical/columnar data stores including Postgres, Druid, Vertica, Redshift, Hadoop, Hive, Cassandra, Aerospike, and Redis Ability to build systems that balance scalability, availability, and latency. Strong ability to advocate for the continual deployment and automation tools, monitoring, and self-healing systems that can help improve the lives of our engineers. Great communication skills and you are a team player who has a proven track record of building strong relationships with management, co-workers, and customers. A desire to learn and grow, push yourself and your team, share lessons with others and provide constructive and continuous feedback, and receptive to feedback from others. ['', 'The Front-End Software Engineer will be critical in the design, build and implementation of the Data Platform UIs, serving an array of audience with different needs, along with internal users working deeply with our dataset.', 'Affinity for a fast-paced work environment;', 'The Front-End Software Engineer\xa0will report directly to the Sr. Engineering Director, Data Products for MethaneSAT, LLC,\xa0and will work closely with other MethaneSAT, LLC staff, key contractors, and EDF staff.\xa0', 'Demonstrated experience leading and collaborating with colleagues and partners of varied backgrounds and experience.', 'Conduct code reviews, bug bashes and design reviews with the team. Research new technologies and work through system issues and bug queue.', 'Design and write software to create intuitive UIs and experiences, features and components.Collaborate effectively with varied stakeholders to help determine the requirements for several audience-specific initiatives.Contribute to the engineering team regarding code quality, best practices, development workflow, test strategy and test coverage.Conduct code reviews, bug bashes and design reviews with the team. Research new technologies and work through system issues and bug queue.Navigate differing needs and priorities effectively and leverage experience to determine most effective design and recommendations.Additional related responsibilities as needed.', 'Navigate differing needs and priorities effectively and leverage experience to determine most effective design and recommendations.', 'Design and write software to create intuitive UIs and experiences, features and components.', 'Strong communication skills and ability to present your ideas to internal stakeholders are a must.', 'Additional related responsibilities as needed.', 'You are applying for a job with MethaneSAT LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of Environmental Defense Fund.', 'MethaneSAT, LLC, an affiliate of Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) is launching a new, high performance, purpose-built satellite--MethaneSAT--to map and measure oil and gas methane emissions worldwide, with the potential to assess emissions from the full range of man-made sources. The satellite will enable us to gather methane emissions data on a global scale and with data from other sources, locate and quantify these emissions.\xa0Data from MethaneSAT will help EDF reduce methane emissions by 45% by 2025 and holds the potential to help reduce the temperature of our planet by as much 0.5 degrees C by the end of the century.\xa0This could be the most impactful environmental project yet conceived.', 'Our UIs and tools must present complex scientific data in ways that allow both the regulator and citizen scientist alike to truly understand and act on it.\xa0This will involve flexibility in querying our dataset, merging it with other datasets and on-the-fly aggregations to drive change.', 'Respect for economic and cultural diversity and ability or experience working with diverse groups of people.', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. BS in Computer Science or technical discipline preferred.Must be a US person (citizen, green card holder).\xa0MethaneSAT, LLC is unable to offer employer-based sponsorship for this role at this time.3 years professional software development experience with demonstrated progressive responsibility and scope.Demonstrated experience with React, Angular, or other modern framework. Must be willing to use/learn React and Typescript.\xa0Experience with handling many data points, managing multiple external services in a web client preferred.Some back-end development experience preferred but not required.Strong communication skills and ability to present your ideas to internal stakeholders are a must.Ability to translate complex science and technical information to non-scientists stakeholdersStrong ability to work independently on a multi-disciplinary team, using independent judgment required to plan, prioritize, and organize diversified workload;Affinity for a fast-paced work environment;Respect for economic and cultural diversity and ability or experience working with diverse groups of people.Demonstrated experience leading and collaborating with colleagues and partners of varied backgrounds and experience.", 'Must be a US person (citizen, green card holder).\xa0MethaneSAT, LLC is unable to offer employer-based sponsorship for this role at this time.', 'Collaborate effectively with varied stakeholders to help determine the requirements for several audience-specific initiatives.', 'Qualifications', '\xa0', '3 years professional software development experience with demonstrated progressive responsibility and scope.', 'Experience with handling many data points, managing multiple external services in a web client preferred.', '\ufeff', 'Working across several organizations, the Front-End Software Engineer will design and write software using best practices that meets the needs of our Data Platform Front-End and our broader project goals.', 'Demonstrated experience with React, Angular, or other modern framework. Must be willing to use/learn React and Typescript.\xa0', "Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. BS in Computer Science or technical discipline preferred.", 'Key Responsibilities', 'Strong ability to work independently on a multi-disciplinary team, using independent judgment required to plan, prioritize, and organize diversified workload;', 'Overall Function', 'Contribute to the engineering team regarding code quality, best practices, development workflow, test strategy and test coverage.', 'Ability to translate complex science and technical information to non-scientists stakeholders', 'Some back-end development experience preferred but not required.']

['', 'The candidate should have previous experience working on advanced research projects with typical tools used in the academic and industrial research community, such as LaTeX and GitHub. The candidate will gain valuable exposure to these new technologies and problem areas, but also build their C.V. with tangible outcomes, like peer-reviewed publications and presentations.', 'The ideal candidate for the position will be a self-motivated individual with the ability to both understand deeply complex technical concepts and to communicate those concepts to a broad team of machine learning and computer security experts, both in written and verbal form. ', 'Company Description', 'In past years, research interns have worked on projects including adversarial attacks on machine learning, generating synthetic social media content to study and detect disinformation campaigns, and using metric learning methods to quantify similarity across binaries. These projects have resulted in presentations at USENIX ScAINet, BlackHat USA, and the AAAI Symposium, along with papers to several peer-reviewed venues.The ideal candidate for the position will be a self-motivated individual with the ability to both understand deeply complex technical concepts and to communicate those concepts to a broad team of machine learning and computer security experts, both in written and verbal form. The candidate should have previous experience working on advanced research projects with typical tools used in the academic and industrial research community, such as LaTeX and GitHub. The candidate will gain valuable exposure to these new technologies and problem areas, but also build their C.V. with tangible outcomes, like peer-reviewed publications and presentations.', 'He or she should have a strong computational background and programming skills, as well as excellent communication skills.', 'The candidate for this FireEye Data Science project is a PhD or Masters student involved in ongoing research at the intersection of machine learning and computer security. The candidate will be expected to make progress on an ambitious research agenda utilizing cutting-edge machine learning methods. He or she should have a strong computational background and programming skills, as well as excellent communication skills.', 'The candidate will be expected to make progress on an ambitious research agenda utilizing cutting-edge machine learning methods. ', 'Responsibilities', 'The candidate for this FireEye Data Science project is a PhD or Masters student involved in ongoing research at the intersection of machine learning and computer security. ', 'In past years, research interns have worked on projects including adversarial attacks on machine learning, generating synthetic social media content to study and detect disinformation campaigns, and using metric learning methods to quantify similarity across binaries. These projects have resulted in presentations at USENIX ScAINet, BlackHat USA, and the AAAI Symposium, along with papers to several peer-reviewed venues.', 'Requirements', 'Job Description']

['', "Must possess a strong knowledge as normally obtained through the completion of a bachelor's degree in informatics, statistics, engineering, or a related business discipline.", 'A position in a Banner Health pharmacy is one you can look forward to. Join an engaging environment of full service, high technology and experience a wide variety of responsibilities. You’ll also see how important a pharmacy job is to our ability to make life easier for our patients. Come enjoy great challenges and build both your knowledge of the field and your analytical skills.', 'PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS', 'MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS', 'Excellent working knowledge of typical word processing, SQL, spreadsheet and/or database applications is required. Strong organizational skills as well as excellent oral and written communication and human relation skills are required. Must have the ability to communicate complex ideas to a non-technical audience.', 'Banner Pharmacy Services provides innovative pharmacy services and coordinated patient care across the continuum leading to improved medication outcomes.\xa0 The Banner Pharmacy Services analytics team has access to state-of-the-art tooling and a comprehensive set of data spanning the care continuum.\xa0 Our mission is to leverage this data to provide better, safer care to the populations we serve, and to drive growth for Banner Pharmacy Services.', 'Experience with department specific software (Cerner, EnterpriseRx, Therigy), including advanced integrated or independent report writing applications. Experience with SAS, Teradata, and/or Tableau. Experience in the pharmacy industry. Advanced knowledge of and experience in program evaluation.', 'A career as an analyst in Banner Pharmacy Services is perfect for an aspiring data scientist looking to hone their skills on a wide array of high-visibility, high-impact projects in a growing business.\xa0 You will be a trusted advisor to senior leaders at Banner Health, and will have the opportunity to present your results directly to key decision-makers.\xa0 While at Arizona’s largest and most comprehensive pharmacy services provider, you will have the chance to make a big impact – both on your career and on the lives of millions of customers.', 'Your pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life.', '\xa0', 'A level of experience as would typically be obtained in no less than 5 years working with complex data environments or systems. Must demonstrate ability to lead project or cross-functional teams to resolve, implement or reach consensus on issues. Advanced business or clinical knowledge and demonstrated ability to utilize technical skills to resolve organizational needs.']

['', ' You work with confidence and without ego. Our data scientists have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of leadership in their daily work. You have strongly-held, defensible ideas, and advocate for what you believe is right. You are also adept at identifying and evaluating trade-offs, willing to be proven wrong, and quick to walk through fire to support your fellow teammates.', ' You have an abundance of intellectual curiosity and are enthusiastic to learn (and teach) new technologies / techniques.', ' You have experience with big data technologies such as Spark or AWS; are able to write efficient SQL; and are proficient in one or more of the following programming languages: R, Python, Java, or Scala. Variety of technical challenge is one of the best things about working at The Trade Desk as a data scientist though which is why we do not expect you to know every technology we use when you start. What we care about is that you can learn quickly and solve complex problems using the best tools for the job.', ' You are a broadly skilled data scientist with experience embedding models into always-on production systems, working across a variety of technologies and data sources.', ' Lead Senior Data Scientists serve both as technical individual contributors and people managers. You will be responsible for owning a technical area as well as building and nurturing a team.', 'WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:', ' You are you comfortable working on an agile, distributed team spanning multiple time zones and continents.', " You have a sustained track record of making significant, self-directed, and end-to-end contributions to large and impactful machine learning projects. You think beyond just the task at hand to deeply understand the 'why' behind what you are doing.", " You have a strong sense of data intuition. At our scale, many off-the-shelf modeling techniques (open source and enterprise) simply don't work. You are able to work from first principles and intuition to develop solutions and adapt them to a unique environment.", 'WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:', ' You are a creative thinker, not bound by "the way things have always been done." What you know is less important than how well you learn and innovate. We don\'t need data scientists who know all the answers; we need data scientists who can invent the answers no one has thought of yet, to the questions yet to be asked.', ' You value, seek out, and foster diversity. We are a global team from many diverse backgrounds, with different experiences and perspectives. To complement this team, you will welcome ideas that are different from your own and be skilled at finding and building from common ground.', 'WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:', ' Lead Senior Data Scientists are end-to-end owners. You will participate actively in all aspects of designing, researching, building, and delivering data-focused products for our clients.', ' You are able to communicate effectively across both technical and non-technical audiences.', ' You are a driver. You will be driving technical projects and providing leadership in a ground-breaking and fast-paced environment. This includes task planning and conducting code reviews, as well as individual code contribution.', ' You have a product-focused mindset. You have the passion and ability to contribute to the process of discovering what will delight our clients and push forward one of the world’s largest and most influential industries toward a vision of openness, transparency, and evidence-based decision-making.', ' You have over 10 years of experience working in a data-driven role, including leading large and impactful technical projects. You may have an advanced degree in a quantitative field, but it’s not a requirement. What and how you can contribute is what’s most important to us which is why our consideration is not limited by the level of education you have.', 'WHO WE ARE:', ' Our Data Science team is embedded into nearly a dozen individual, mission-focused engineering teams working across a wide spectrum of technological and scientific challenges. You will have the opportunity, depending on your interests and background, to own problems related to natural language processing and machine learning over hundreds of millions of web pages, graph mining and algorithmic optimization on petabytes of data, and causal inference with missing data - to name a few.', ' Lead Senior Data Scientists contribute to more than our product – they build up our team. Through a combination of mentoring, technical leadership, and direct people-management, they make others better and raise the bar for those around them.']

['Key skills/ Requirements: ', '', 'Masters (with 7+ years industry experience) or PhD (4+ years industry experience) in Science, Math, Engineering or computational related field. ['The Senior Data Analyst will be part of a growing team in our Law360 newsroom, helping to design surveys and rankings of law firms and conduct analyses that support our efforts to report on the legal industry. The Senior Data Analyst would support the accurate, timely, relevant and efficient delivery of that research, and would work collaboratively with editors, reporters and graphic designers to develop surveys and analyze the results. The analyst would also develop research strategies and the systematic organization of data. The analyst will employ statistical methods to help improve analyses and data usage. ', 'Develop customized data analyses that address questions of core interest to readers. ', 'Participate in drafting and presenting key research findings to reporters and editors. ', 'Experience working with data of varying quality and from varying sources. ', 'Take ownership of our data set. Work with a wide range of stakeholders in Editorial and IT with regard to data management. ', 'Conduct surveys and interviews. Help develop the methodologies used in annual reports and rankings from survey data. Enhance current surveys and develop additional surveys. Collaborate with editors on research projects, based on surveys and publicly available data. Participate in drafting and presenting key research findings to reporters and editors. Combine, clean and verify data from multiple sources. Take ownership of our data set. Work with a wide range of stakeholders in Editorial and IT with regard to data management. Develop customized data analyses that address questions of core interest to readers. ', 'Bachelor’s degree in public policy, economics, statistics, computer science or related field is preferred ', 'Conduct surveys and interviews. ', 'A good teammate, collaborator and relationship builder who can also work independently. ', 'Familiarity with R programming, Tableau and/or Python a plus. ', 'Preferred Qualification: ', 'Legal industry research experience preferred but not required. ', 'Combine, clean and verify data from multiple sources. ', 'Advanced Excel skills (e.g., Pivot Tables). ', 'Law360 offices are located in NYC, Washington DC, and Los Angeles. We offer a casual and flexible work environment, comprehensive benefits (including; medical, dental, generous paid time off, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and a pre-tax commuter program), and competitive salary. ', 'Collaborate with editors on research projects, based on surveys and publicly available data. ', 'Legal industry research experience preferred but not required. A good teammate, collaborator and relationship builder who can also work independently. Expertise using quantitative analytical tools. Advanced Excel skills (e.g., Pivot Tables). Familiarity with R programming, Tableau and/or Python a plus. Experience with data visualization techniques, Tableau experience preferred. Experience working with data of varying quality and from varying sources. Ability to communicate complex ideas to a wide range of audiences. Bachelor’s degree in public policy, economics, statistics, computer science or related field is preferred ', 'Basic Qualification: ', '3+ years of related experience, with a minimum of one year of experience working with data analysis, including data management, cleaning, analysis and report writing. Relevant coursework may count toward this experience. ', 'Experience with data visualization techniques, Tableau experience preferred. ', 'Law360, a LexisNexis company, is seeking qualified candidates for the position of Senior Data Analyst to join our newsroom. ', 'Portfolio Media Inc.is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com. ', 'Ability to communicate complex ideas to a wide range of audiences. ', 'Primary Duties/Responsibilities: ', 'Enhance current surveys and develop additional surveys. ', 'Expertise using quantitative analytical tools. ', ' ', 'Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy', 'Help develop the methodologies used in annual reports and rankings from survey data. ', 'Law360, a LexisNexis company, is an online newswire for business lawyers that covers major litigation, transactions, and regulatory issues. Founded in 2004 and acquired by LexisNexis in 2012, Law360 is a cutting-edge organization and one of the fastest-growing subscription news services in the U.S. Our subscribers include the largest law firms in the U.S. and around the world, in-house counsel at major corporations, and key decision-makers in the government sector. platform organization is responsible for the overall fraud and abuse protection product strategy. The focus of the team is to define the product requirements, research the best way to defend against the threat vectors and architect the product to meet the following key requirements: Detection: Detect automated and human fraud / abuse through various methods with high accuracy. The detection must be tightly integrated with the challenge framework so as to adopt the most effective response strategy depending on the risk associated with the request session. The challenge framework is managed by Matt Ford’s Product Challenge organization. Visibility: provide a set of dashboard and reports to customers, partner and our support team to allow them to visualize and analyze the fraud activity detected by the product Serviceability: provide customers the ability tune the detection and response strategy based on the risk score. Also provide customers the ability to craft custom logic to meet their own requirements. The product platform consists of technical product managers and the product research team. The product research team is responsible for coming up with different ways to process data collected on a session in order to differentiate bot from human traffic but also detect human fraud within the human traffic. The team may use different techniques including but not limited to statistical model, unsupervised learning, supervised learning, deep learning, whichever model is the most effective to meet the accuracy requirements.', 'A Bachelor or Masters Degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent experience\xa0']

['Education Requirements: ', 'Special Skills Requirements: ', 'Essential Job Functions:  Develops and creates original reports and applications using tools such as Power BI, MS SQL Server, SAS, Access based on multiple sources of information Evaluates information being reported for consistency, completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness Communicates with representatives both within and outside the organization regarding data requirements for both new and existing applications Prepares internal and/or external correspondence related to the development and understanding of information Conducts research into proposed solutions regarding data quality issues as well as for the development of new reports or applications Assists in the training and development of other professional personnel as assigned Promotes safety at all times and complies with safety/ergonomic standards as outlined in relevant company published manuals Performs other duties as assigned  Experience Requirements:  5+ years of overall Data Analyst experience 5+ years of experience working with development tools including but not limited to Power BI, Tableau, SQL Analysis Server, SQL Server 5+ years of working in requirements gathering, documentation, development, testing, production support using Business Intelligence reporting tools like Tableau/Power BI Experience with a conceptual design of business applications; building complex Power BI/Tableau reports and dashboards Designing complex ad hoc queries/reports against normalized databases, operational data stores, dimensional models Conducting training for Team members/Business Users and assisting with User acceptance Testing Assist with managing/maintaining/configuring the reporting tool Support Users in detailed rough orders of magnitudes (ROMs) or estimates Working with SQL programming Debugging on various platforms such as SQL Server, or similar database technologies.  Experience must also include large volume data processing using the following tools: SQL/DB2/ORACLE/MS Access; and Excel. Experience working in an Agile environment  Special Skills Requirements:  Working knowledge of data management concepts as applied to insurance, including data quality, data reporting, data warehousing, and data mart applications Knowledge of tools and applications, such as SAS, Syncsort, Excel VBA, Access, or Business Objects. ['', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Experience with biotherapeutics analytical methods such as HPLC (SE-HPLC, IEX, RP-HPLC), SDS-PAGE, Capillary Gel electrophoresis (CGE), imaged Capillary Electrophoresis (iCE), spectroscopy techniques', 'The incumbent will assist in the development and scale-up of drug product processes from bench top to pilot scale and, as required, technology transfer to commercial plants. Examples of drug product processes are fluid transport, sterilizing filtration and lyophilization.', 'M.S. Degree in above, and 0-2 years of experience preferred.Some knowledge or experience of drug development processes for progression of a biological candidate.Familiarity with dosing and administration techniques.Familiarity with pharmacy practices.Excellent documentation skills.Self-motivated and highly effective in a team-based environment.Effective written and oral communication skills.Familiarity with GMP requirements.Working knowledge of HPLC (SE-HPLC, IEX, RP-HPLC), SDS-PAGE, Capillary Gel electrophoresis (CGE), imaged Capillary Electrophoresis (iCE), spectroscopy techniques is highly desirable.', 'Role Responsibilities', 'This position will be responsible for preparing data summary presentation, compiling data and authoring technical reports.', 'Sunshine Act', "Bachelor's Degree with 2-4 years of experience OR Master's Degree with 0-2 years of experience with a degree in Pharmaceutics, Chemistry, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering, Pharmacy, Biology, Biochemistry or equivalentExperience in Laboratory/Clinical/Pharmacy setting and with a variety of laboratory techniques is required.Ability to follow established procedures independently is required.Experience with biotherapeutics analytical methods such as HPLC (SE-HPLC, IEX, RP-HPLC), SDS-PAGE, Capillary Gel electrophoresis (CGE), imaged Capillary Electrophoresis (iCE), spectroscopy techniquesDemonstrated scientific documentation skills", 'Some knowledge or experience of drug development processes for progression of a biological candidate.', "The incumbent will assist in the development of dosage and administration instructions, responding to clinical and commercial queries relevant to dosing and handling, understanding and implementing current and future clinical guidance's. ", 'Familiarity with pharmacy practices.', 'EEO & Employment Eligibility', 'Ability to follow established procedures independently is required.', 'Other Details', 'Last Date to Apply: Oct 15, 2020Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: Yes', 'Excellent documentation skills.', 'The Senior Associate Scientist must be able to interact effectively with a multi-disciplinary team of scientists across departments/groups for the overall clinical and commercial development of overall pipeline.', 'Effective communication skills are desirable for interactions with laboratory scientists, project managers and colleagues from numerous functions, serving on multi-disciplinary project teams.', 'Experience in Laboratory/Clinical/Pharmacy setting and with a variety of laboratory techniques is required.', 'Perform rapid, comprehensive characterization of candidate molecules to determine the stability profile and applying this information to develop an appropriate dosage form to meet clinical needs. The Senior Associate Scientist must be able to interact effectively with a multi-disciplinary team of scientists across departments/groups for the overall clinical and commercial development of overall pipeline.Participate in developing parenteral formulations for biotherapeutic modalities such as monoclonal antibodies, antibody drug conjugates, proteins, vaccines, oligonucleotides, and viral vectors for genomic therapeutics. ', 'Major Duties And Responsibilities', ' Design, develop, automate and implement big data clusters using Hadoop, YARN, Hive, Zookeeper, Kafka, NoSQL components.  Perform Platform administration and automation of Hadoop and Kafka including installation, maintenance, and configuration.  Perform troubleshooting and resolution management, and provide support to the customer, users, and technical teams.  Resolve issues related to development, operations, implementations, and system status.  Research and recommend options for department direction on Big Data management. Manage and maintain all production and non-production Hadoop and Kafka clusters and its infrastructure.  Develop run books for Ansible, Shell script, and Python for automation.  Review, develop, and walk through Java and Scala code to implement best practices and tuning.  Support multiple clusters of medium to large complexity with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity, and accessibility of data.  Create and maintain standard operating procedures and templates for cluster user access.  Design and implement a toolset that simplifies provisioning and support of a large cluster environment.  Enable and configure Kerberos for Hadoop components and implement enterprise security for Hadoop and Kafka.  Enable data encryption at rest and at motion with TLS/SSL to meet the security standards.  Responsible for system backups, and coordinate with infrastructure team for storage and rotation of backups is accomplished.  Big Data tenant onboarding, Enable Sentry for RBAC (role-based access control) to have a privilege level access to the data in HDFS/Hive/Kafka as per the security policies.  Perform cluster maintenance as well as creation and removal of nodes  Design and implement Backup and Disaster Recovery strategy  Participate in new tool discovery and technical deep-dive sessions, Proof-Of-Concept (POC) development with prospects  Screen Hadoop cluster job performances, manage, troubleshoot and review Hadoop log files. ['Work with our Engineering teams to integrate your solutions into Conversant’s platform.', 'Provide technology leadership to yield innovative differentiating solutions.', 'Use your expertise in data science and/or computer science to research and recommend solutions to our technology and business problems.', 'RESPONSIBILITIES', 'Conduct projects end-to-end from early stage research through development, in consultation with stakeholders.', 'Develop an understanding of Conversant’s personalization platform and proprietary datasets.', 'We prioritize talent and potential over having closely similar prior experience. ['', ' Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets * Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources * Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies – Redshift, S3, EC2, Data-pipeline and other big data technologies * Experience providing technical leadership and mentor other engineers for the best practices on the data engineering space * Experience using machine learning and statistical tools such as Python/Pandas, R etc . * Linux/UNIX including to process large data sets.', 'Preferred Qualifications', ' A desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment. * Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field and at least 4 years work experience * Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g., Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, Data Scientist) with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets. * Demonstrated ability in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing. * Experience with Oracle, Redshift, Teradata, etc. * Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Pig, Spark, etc.) * Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc)', 'Description', 'Company', 'Basic Qualifications']
